WorkItem.Description:
With the changes that I am making for the different image storage location, I am using a setting in the web.config.  I think that we need an additional page in the admin area to enable settings changes without loading web.config in an editor.
 
Or maybe just a first launch page, to be used the first time the site is installed.  Have it work like this:
 
1. New site admin launches settings.aspx
2. New site admin adjusts the site settings (club name, website address, etc).  They click Save.
3. New site admin creates a user login that automatically gets added to Administrators.
4. Page redirects to Default.aspx.
5. Part of Page_Load for Default.aspx deletes settings.aspx if it is present.
 
Obviously, this is a one-time thing.  But that would make it easier for new sites to be configured, sortof runs right out of the box.
WorkItem.Summary: Admin page for changing app settings

Comments.Message: Yea. I think we should save settings into a file in the App_Data folder. The My Personal Site StarterKit generates a settings file which you can edit.
oops... I meant My Web Pages Starter Kit (http://www.codeplex.com/MyWebPagesStarterKit)
Can't changes be made to the settings in the web.config?
I don't think so. I haven't seen anything about editing it. The only tool I know of that can change the web.config is the ASP.NET Configuration manager.
